title: Video of infant and woman's dead bodies dug out from ground is unrelated to Delhi riots
author: www.altnews.in
vclaim:
Protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) entered the third month in February 2020. Communal clashes between those against the law and pro-CAA groups led to the death of at least 45 people in Delhi. Misinformation on social media, however, continues to promote hate. In the latest spree, a video where dead bodies of a baby and a woman are dug out from the ground is circulating on social media. A Twitter user Major Muhammad Arif (@marifthahim) shared the clip and wrote, “Muslims are being buried alive in India.”

The video is being shared with the same claim by several users on Twitter and Facebook.

Alt News reverse-searched keyframes from the video on Google and found a report from West Bengal published by eisamay.indiatimes.comon January 31, 2020. According to the report, the incident took place in Haluguch village under the jurisdiction of Islampur police station in North Dinajpur. A man named Akbar Ali allegedly murdered his wife and month-and-a-half-year-old baby after a domestic spat. Ali buried the dead bodies near his residence which were dug out after villagers suspected wrongdoing. The enraged locals also set Ali’s house on fire but he managed to escape.



We also found a video report by News18 Bangla which describes the complete incident.

Therefore, an incident from West Bengal where a man allegedly murdered and buried his wife and child was communalised on social media and presented as a case related to Delhi riots.
